channel.title: 18. Making Plans – Talking About the Future and Arrangements on Italiano con Geoff
channel.description: Recent content in 18. Making Plans – Talking About the Future and Arrangements on Italiano con Geoff

item.title: Lesson 18.1: Making Plans – Using Modal Verbs (Volere, Potere, Dovere)
item.description: Learn how to make, suggest, and sometimes avoid plans in Italian – with help from Geoff, Viktor, and a surprisingly busy calendar.

item.title: Exercise 18.1: Practice – Making Plans with Modal Verbs
item.description: Practice using ‘volere’, ‘potere’, and ‘dovere’ to make, accept, or skillfully avoid plans in Italian.

item.title: Lesson 18.2: When and Where? – Talking About Days, Times, and Places
item.description: Learn how to say when and where you want to meet — because ‘sometime, somewhere’ doesn’t work when making Italian plans.

item.title: Exercise 18.2: Practice – When and Where?
item.description: Practice talking about days, times, and places in Italian – and finally decide where to meet (or at least try).

item.title: Lesson 18.3: Let’s Do It! – Making Suggestions in Italian
item.description: Learn how to make suggestions and invite people in Italian – from casual coffee invites to overly ambitious weekend plans (Geoff-style).

item.title: Exercise 18.3: Practice – Making Suggestions in Italian
item.description: Practice making Italian-style suggestions – from a simple coffee invite to Geoff’s creative ways of avoiding running.
